                Dear Colleague,
				


                The Cube from CLC bio brings supercomputing
power to
your desktop at a price you won't believe. Now
shipping with the Smith-Waterman
sequence-matching
search (more
algorithms are under development) for precise
sequence searches  at up to 200 times the
speed of a
standard laptop!
                

                That speed reduces an analysis time of 14
hours on a
desktop machine to just 7 minutes, and approaches
the performance of
a high-end cluster - at a tiny fraction of
the cost,
on your own desk, and fully portable!
                

                Compared with our recently announced Cell,
which accesses inbuilt features of modern
microprocessors, the Cube is separate
massively parallel hardware designed for
customers who need even faster computer power
or have existing large investments in older
computer hardware or clusters.
                

Until the end of May 2007, the Cube comes
bundled with CLC Combined Workbench - the
bioinformatics software industry leader in
features and ease of use - for no extra
charge!








                    What is the Bioinformatics Cube?
                    


 




                    The next big thing in bioinformatics is small
                    



The Bioinformatics Cube is a massively parallel
hardware accelerator for bioinformatics analyses,
based on FPGA (Field Programmable Gate Array)
technology and connected to your computer by a fast
USB 2.0 cable.


FPGA technology is not only at the heart of the
massively parallel processing that gives the Cube
its astounding speed, but enables easy updating and
addition of algorithms via software, downloaded via
the internet.


USB connection provides fast and nearly universal
connectability, and coupled with the small size and
weight of the Cube (1.3 kg), complete portability.


Note: Your institution will need its own
local database for Cube searches. The Cube cannot
search over the internet, as such searches are
performed remotely by the host servers.














                    Why Smith-Waterman?
                    


 




                    Perfect precision for better science
                    


                    BLAST is the most popular search algorithm,
returning reasonable matches quickly.
But BLAST achieves its speed by sacrificing
precision. Do you know how many search results you
are missing when using BLAST? Up to 50% of the hits
are not found using BLAST.
                    

If you want 100% of the answers, the Smith-Waterman
algorithm is the answer. But its precision comes at
a price, and for most people, it is just too slow to
be useful in their daily research.


Now with The Cube, you don't need compromises. The
Cube delivers Smith-Waterman results at speeds up to
100 times that of a 3 GHz PC, providing results at
speeds
approaching that of BLAST. All you require is a
desktop computer with a
USB 2.0 port - and a 12 cm square of desk space to
sit it on.


Read CLC's White Paper on The Cube...












                    What Do I Get?
                    


 




                    More reasons to buy...
                    


                    Until the end of May 2007, each Cube comes
bundled with one licence of the CLC Combined
Workbench, which sells on its own for
thousands of dollars! (The Combined
Workbench is CLC bio's flagship product,
providing a
wide range of basic and leading-edge Gene and
Protein analyses.)
                    

The initial release of The Cube includes just one
algorithm, the Smith-Waterman. However each
purchase
entitles you to one year of additional algorithms
without further charge. CLC bio is actively
developing several new algorithms, and as
each new
algorithm
(automatically bundled into future releases
of The
Cube) will attract an extra price of more than
$1,000, buying now makes The Cube an even more
attractive proposition.














                    Ease of Use
                    


 




                    As simple as it is fast
                    


                    As the Bioinformatics Cube is seamlessly
integrated
with CLC bio's bioinformatics software solutions,
you will have an easy access to using the cube,
based on a graphical user interface.
                    

                    From within the workbenches you can simply
select to
perform the given analysis locally on your
computer
with the CPU power available - or select the
Bioinformatics Cube and have your computing speed
increase significantly.
                    

And don't forget that  until end of May 2007,
when you buy a Bioinformatics Cube, you'll
automatically get a full license for CLC
Combined Workbench.


                    Or if you prefer, you can also use a
command line interface of an internal web
interface.
                    













                    Who is The Cube for?
                    


 




                    Power for The People
                    


                    The low cost and small size of The Cube and its
simple USB 2.0 connection and integration
with CLC
bio's graphical software makes it ideal for
individual researchers and labs with access
to local
databases and who need precise, reliable
searches in
quick timeframes.
                    

The power of The Cube also makes it ideal for
central bioinformatics facilities and
services, with
power within shouting distance of Computer
Clusters
at a fraction of the cost.
